intro: Moehringia trinervia, commonly known as the three-veined moehringia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically forms dense mats of foliage. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves with three distinct veins, giving it its common name. Its flowers are tiny, clustered in dense inflorescences, and are usually pale blue or white in color. Moehringia trinervia is often found in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions.
